complex

Class Cpx

  • java.lang.Object
    • complex.Cpx

  • public final class Cpx
extends Object
    Implementation of Complex Numbers.

      • asPolar

        public void asPolar(double[] polarData)
        Inserts the given polar coodinate data into the given array. The first array element, polarData[0] is the magnitude, and polarData[1] is the argument (angle subtended by positive real axis). The polarData argument must be a non-null double array with of length at least 2.
        Parameters:
        polarData - array

      • arg

        public double arg()
        Calculates the argument of this complex number, the angle which this complex number creates with the positive real axis on the complex plane.
        Returns:
        argument value

      • normalize

        public void normalize()
        Normalizes this complex number by dividing both real and imaginary parts by the magnitude of the complex number.

      • conjugate

        public Cpx conjugate()
        Returns a new complex number equal to the conjugate of this complex number.
        e.g. for given complex number
        a + i*b
        this method will return a complex number equal to
        a - i*b
        Returns:
        complex conjugate

      • divide

        public Cpx divide(Cpx other)
           throws ArithmeticException
        Returns a new Complex Number equal to this complex number divided by the given Complex Number. If the magnitude of the complex number parameter is zero then an ArithmeticException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        other - complex number
        Returns:
        complex number
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException

      • divider

        public Cpx divider(double real)
            throws ArithmeticException
        Returns a new complex number equal to this complex number divided by the given real number. If the real number argument is zero then an ArithmeticException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        real - real number
        Returns:
        complex number
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException

      • dividei

        public Cpx dividei(double imaginary)
            throws ArithmeticException
        Returns a new complex number equal to this complex number divided by the given imaginary number. If the imaginary number argument is zero then an ArithmeticException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        imaginary - imaginary number
        Returns:
        complex number
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException
